title: U.S. teens : most frequently accessed social networks 2019
yAxis: Share of respondents who use network most often
summary: This is a bar chart representing Platform in the x axis and Share of respondents who use network most often in the y axis.
The Share of respondents who use network most often is highest at Platform Instagram and lowest at Platform Other.
There is a difference of 24.0 between the maximum Platform Instagram and minimum Platform Other.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents who use network most often for 9 number of Platforms.
Platform Instagram has the highest Share of respondents who use network most often and Other has the lowest Share of respondents who use network most often.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Platform in the x axis and Share of respondents who use network most often in the y axis.
The Share of respondents who use network most often is highest at Platform Instagram and lowest at Platform Other.
There is a difference of 24.0 between the maximum Platform Instagram and minimum Platform Other.
max_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Platform, and Share of respondents who use network most often in each Platform on the y axis.
Platform Instagram has the highest Share of respondents who use network most often and Other has the lowest Share of respondents who use network most often.
The second highest Share of respondents who use network most often is appeared to be the Platform .
The highest Platform Instagram has 24.0 more Share of respondents who use network most often than the lowest Platform Other.
Share of respondents who use network most often at Platform Instagram is 25.0 , second place is  at 25.0, and thirdly is Snapchat at 22.0.
Similar Share of respondents who use network most often is found in Platform Other, and Don't know.
Considered together, the average Share of respondents who use network most often in all 9 Platforms is roughly 11.11.
Summing up the values of all Platforms, we get total 100.0.
